author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Travel delay warning for spectators of Rugby World Cup match in Cardiff - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Travel delay warning for spectators of Rugby World Cup match in Cardiff Published on : Wednesday, September 23, 2015
As Australia is all set to take on Fiji in Cardiff in the Rugby World Cup match, travelers and fans are warned about delays in the traffic and train services. Thousands of spectators are expected to travel to the Millennium Stadium where the game will kick off at 16:45 BST on Wednesday.
Arriva Trains Wales have issued a public statement:
All public transport will be extremely busy. Use the earliest available train and allow plenty of extra time for journeys to and from Cardiff. Many trains will be full and all standing room will be used. We advise against non-essential travel on Wednesday afternoon and evening.
After the match, return to the train station as quickly as possible. For customer safety, a queuing system will operate for entry into Cardiff Central Rail Station. Please be aware that waiting times may be up to 2 hours. This queuing system is the safest and most effective way to enable everyone to board the right train. Please use warm, weatherproof clothing.
Please be patient â€“ Arriva Trains Wales, Great Western Railways and CrossCountry will be operating all available trains and doing everything possible to help you get home safely. We hope you have a great day.
Travelers are urged to be patient as Arriva will be instrumental in its services and will continue services even if there are delays. 35,000 people are expected to travel for this massive Rugby encounter.
